titleStmt.title: A certaine relation of the Earle of Ormonds nine dayes passages at his last going into the pale against the rebels. And also setting forth what prisoners he hath taken, and what Lords and gentlemen of the pale are come in and tendred themselves to his lordshipp. Likewise what townes he hath burnt, and what store of pillage hee sent and brought home with him. Latly sent from an honorable person in Dublin, to a worthy Irish gentleman now in England.
titleStmt.author: W. L.

titleStmt.title: A certaine relation of the Earle of Ormonds nine dayes passages at his last going into the pale against the rebels. And also setting forth what prisoners he hath taken, and what Lords and gentlemen of the pale are come in and tendred themselves to his lordshipp. Likewise what townes he hath burnt, and what store of pillage hee sent and brought home with him. Latly sent from an honorable person in Dublin, to a worthy Irish gentleman now in England.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
